We always use a taxi from the airport to downtown Rome. It’s easy, quick, and convenient. The rates are standardized by law. I don’t remember the exact amount but think they’re about 50 Euros but a bit more at night.

In my experience arriving after a long flight isn’t the time to be economical. You’ll probably be tired and if you haven’t been there before you’ll likely to be flustered. So paying for the convenience of having the taxi take you directly to your hotel is money well spent. And if there are two or three of you it might not be that expensive anyway. Because if your group takes a bus, for instance, each person will have to buy a ticket but the one taxi fee covers both of you. Plus, you go right to your hotel without having to tote your bags around and with no stops elsewhere. For me, a taxi after landing is well worth it!

2nd piece of advice
